alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 11:59AM MST until August 27 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 300 PM MST. * At 1158 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across areas of Yavapai County including Mayer and Spring Valley. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott Valley, Mayer, Poland Junction, Spring Valley, Walker, Cordes, Cordes Junction, Cordes Lakes, Groom Creek Subdivision, Lynx Lake Dam and Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 280. Interstate 17 between mile markers 259 and 266. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Wolf Creek, Hackberry Creek, Chaparral Gulch, Milk Creek, Yarber Wash, Badger Spring Wash, Little Ash Creek, Lynx Creek, Little Wolf Creek, Cedar Creek, Bannon Creek, Ash Creek, Turkey Creek, Big Bug Creek, Sycamore Creek, Antelope Creek, Brushy Wash, Mineral Creek, Hassayampa River, Agua Fria River, Pine Creek and Grapevine Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
